issue.title: using ARMv8 Assembly for liboqs
issue.body:
I'm trying to replace NTT code with assembly using NEON and building for integration with liboqs. The implementation environment is ARMv8.2 based ubuntu environment, and the target algorithm is dilithium. However, the build does not proceed with an error about the assembly item at compile time. Looking at the error items, it seems that CMAKE does not build based on ARMv8.

Examples of error items are as follows.
[../~/asm.S : 312:12 error : invalid suffix "b" on floating constant, MOV v26.16b, v2.16b]

Are there any build options I need to modify if leveraging assemblies? I didn't find that issue in various documents including the README.txt.
![화면 캡처 2022-02-03 143728](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60723218/152288030-b1f3cd0b-968b-4d17-8321-16ce754a8f9f.jpg)

issue.title: scan-build warnings in Picnic
issue.body:
@christianpaquin Running scan-build (inspired by the very old #193; see #1211 for details on how to run scan-build now) yields the following.

```
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_types.c:37:19: warning: Potential leak of memory pointed to by 'slab' [unix.Malloc]
  tape->pos     = 0;
                  ^
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_types.c:153:10: warning: Potential leak of memory pointed to by 'slab' [unix.Malloc]
  return msgs;
         ^~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_types.c:198:10: warning: Potential leak of memory pointed to by 'slab' [unix.Malloc]
  return commitments;
         ^~~~~~~~~~~
3 warnings generated.

/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_impl.c:221:14: warning: Use of zero-allocated memory [unix.Malloc]
      setBit(tapes->tape[last], params->lowmc.n + params->lowmc.n * 2 * (j) + i,
             ^~~~~~~~~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_impl.c:271:38: warning: Division by zero [core.DivideZero]
      calloc(params->digest_size * 8 / MIN(bitsPerChunkP, bitsPerChunkC), sizeof(uint16_t));
             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_impl.c:477:12: warning: Use of zero-allocated memory [unix.Malloc]
    memset(tapes[t].tape[unopened], 0, 2 * params->view_size);
           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX12.3.sdk/usr/include/secure/_string.h:77:27: note: expanded from macro 'memset'
                __builtin___memset_chk (dest, __VA_ARGS__, __darwin_obsz0 (dest))
                                        ^~~~
3 warnings generated.

/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_tree.c:322:22: warning: Dereference of undefined pointer value [core.NullDereference]
    pathSets[pos][i] = node;
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_tree.c:325:24: warning: Dereference of undefined pointer value [core.NullDereference]
      pathSets[pos][i] = node;
      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^~~~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/picnic3_tree.c:353:3: warning: 1st function call argument is an uninitialized value [core.CallAndMessage]
  free(pathSets[0]);
  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/Users/dstebila/Dev/OQS/liboqs/src/sig/picnic/external/oqs_picnic_macros.h:12:14: note: expanded from macro 'free'
#define free OQS_MEM_insecure_free
             ^
3 warnings generated.
```
